meta.title: MCIF 7.1 Master Schema (Full)
meta.author: Hayden Andrew Carr | Meta-Cognitive Intelligence Project
meta.description: Full, expanded, production-grade MCIF 7.1 schema file. Contains phases, metrics, prompts, scoring, branching, archetypes, ledger and adapters. Internal normalized scale: 0..1. Human report scale: 700 points.

changelog.author: Hayden Andrew Carr
changelog.notes: Full schema expansion from MCIF 7.1 white page. For engine consumption and audit.

consentTemplates.title: MCIF 7.1 Participant Consent
consentTemplates.text: You are about to take a reflective cognitive session. Responses are analyzed to produce adaptive feedback. Data is anonymized by default; you may opt-in for research export. You may delete your session at any time. Analysis is reflective, not diagnostic.

dataRetentionPolicy.deletionProcedure: User can delete data via Settings -> Export & Delete. Ledger will keep non-identifying hash of deletion event.

ethicsCouncil.notes: Add ethics council contact list before clinical deployment.

explainabilityRules: Every composite includes metric-level evidence items.
Every adaptive weight change must be logged with rationale.
Archetype mapping must attach the rule expression and contributing metric vector.

phases.name: Perceptual Awareness
phases.summary: Elicit rich sensory detail and early contextual framing.
phases.phaseNotes: Encourage close observation and short, precise descriptions. Use reminders to 'notice specific senses'.

phases.name: Cognitive Mechanics
phases.summary: Probe logical structure, systems thinking, and pragmatic creativity.
phases.phaseNotes: Require explicit step counts for logic questions. Encourage naming of stakeholders when systems thinking is tested.

phases.name: Emotive Intelligence
phases.summary: Probe emotional literacy, causal chains, and self-compassion.
phases.phaseNotes: Offer gentle language prompts and an optional voice input method for participants who prefer speaking.

phases.name: Meta-Cognitive Insight
phases.summary: Elicit awareness of one’s own cognitive processes and remedies.
phases.phaseNotes: Prompts should request numbered steps and expected timelines. Ledger entries must be created for diagnostic steps.

phases.name: Creative Intelligence
phases.summary: Test novelty, coherence, and cross-domain integration.
phases.phaseNotes: Provide optional visual canvas and bullet-point answer mode for creative mapping.

phases.name: Philosophical Depth & Applied Integration
phases.summary: Close session with abstraction, ethics, and application.
goals: Commit to short term application steps
phases.phaseNotes: End with an action step to encourage living the insight.

metrics.name: Sensory Clarity
metrics.description: Precision and richness of multisensory detail.

metrics.name: Contextual Recognition
metrics.description: Ability to place perception in useful context.

metrics.name: Pattern Detection
metrics.description: Noticing and hypothesizing patterns or regularities.

metrics.name: Focus Stability
metrics.description: Sustained attention with minimal drift.

metrics.name: Cognitive Load Balance
metrics.description: Appropriate depth without cognitive overload.

metrics.name: Logic
metrics.description: Clarity and validity of stepwise reasoning.

metrics.name: Systems Thinking
metrics.description: Understanding interactions, feedback loops, and stakeholders.

metrics.name: Practical Creativity
metrics.description: Novel yet implementable ideas.

metrics.name: Emotional Identification
metrics.description: Precision in naming affective states.

metrics.name: Causal Insight
metrics.description: Linking events in cause-effect chains.

metrics.name: Self-Compassion
metrics.description: A non-judgmental stance and practical kindness toward self.

metrics.name: Meta-Awareness
metrics.description: Recognition of one's cognitive mechanics and habitual patterns.

metrics.name: Process Diagnosis
metrics.description: Accuracy and clarity in mapping one's internal procedure and bottlenecks.

metrics.name: Remedy Clarity
metrics.description: How concrete and measurable proposed remedies are.

metrics.name: Novelty
metrics.description: Degree of originality or divergence from typical responses.

metrics.name: Coherence
metrics.description: Narrative and internal consistency of creative output.

metrics.name: Integration
metrics.description: Ability to combine domains into a coherent, useable whole.

metrics.name: Depth
metrics.description: Philosophical or conceptual nuance and sustained argument.

metrics.name: Logical Consistency
metrics.description: Absence of contradiction and existence of coherent argumentation.

metrics.name: Existential Clarity
metrics.description: Ability to articulate a clear stance about purpose or potential.

metrics.name: Ethical Coherence
metrics.description: Consideration of harm/benefit and moral consistency.

metrics.name: Applied Strategy
metrics.description: Clarity of pragmatic steps to implement insights.

metrics.name: Adaptability Index
metrics.description: How well the user reconfigures across phases; computed from cross-phase variance and corrective action.

scoringHints.note: Computed from standard deviation across normalized primary metrics and presence of corrective actions within a session.

prompts.text: Describe an everyday object as if perceiving it for the first time. Focus on at least three sensory details.
exampleResponses: A chipped ceramic mug: rough rim, thin hairline crack on the side, residual coffee ring that smells of caramel; it clinks with a hollow tone when tapped.
prompts.authorNotes: Use gentle prompts to coax sensory specificity.

prompts.text: Try describing just the surface textures. What do you notice first when you touch the object?
Now look for patterns across similar objects. What common features emerge and why might they exist?
List sensory features (sight, sound, touch, smell, temperature) of the object in short bullets.
What distractions or assumptions made this description harder? Name the top two.
Design a sustainable fix for a team that keeps missing deadlines. Provide steps, responsible roles, and simple metrics to monitor progress.
If you were to simplify your solution to three essential steps, what would they be?
Provide an optimization metric that could reduce delays by 30% and explain how you'd measure it.
Map the main process flow of the team and locate two bottlenecks—state why they occur and how you'd test the fix.
Identify and justify the main trade-offs inherent in your proposed solution.
Explain why scrolling your phone eases pre-speech anxiety.
Trace the chain from initial discomfort to the calming effect—list the trigger, immediate reaction, and downstream soothing behaviors.
Offer a compassionate reframe and one small practice to try next time.
You understand your patterns but rarely act; what blocks you from following through?
Map your internal sequence from noticing a pattern to taking (or not taking) action. Be concrete.
Propose a concrete remedy with steps, timeline, and an expected signal of success.
Invent a new form of intelligence measurement superior to IQ. Describe its core principle and a sample task.
Map how your measurement combines domains and what it predicts about behavior or learning.
Where could this idea fail and how would you adapt? Provide one short contingency.
Is human potential fixed or ever-expanding? Explain the implications of your view.
Evaluate the ethical implications of the measurement or remedy you proposed.
Describe one concrete way you will apply your insights in the next 7 days. Include one measurable signal of success.

hybrid_keyword_length_coherence.description: Primary method for free_text prompts: keyword match (semantic), response length normalized to expected, and coherence heuristics.
steps: compute coherenceScore = coherenceHeuristic(response) // see appendix heuristics
raw = weighted sum: kw*w1 + length*w2 + coh*w3 (weights defined per prompt)

rating_scale.description: Maps numeric rating to 0..1 by dividing by max rating.

bayesianTemplates.description: Templates to compute posterior belief about latent traits. Not computed by default; enabled when adapter 'bayesian_engine' is active.

nodes.description: When minPromptsAnswered and minMetricNormalized satisfied, move to next phase

archetypes.label: Reflective Architect
archetypes.description: High meta-awareness and logical structuring. Strong at modeling processes and proposing clear remedies.
archetypes.practitionerNotes: Encourage translating reflection into measurable experiments.

archetypes.label: Empathic Inventor
archetypes.description: Creative and emotionally literate; strong in integrated idea formation with affective insight.

archetypes.label: Visionary Synthesist
archetypes.description: Combines deep logic, philosophical depth and creativity for high-level synthesis.

recommendedExercises.title: Ground visionary ideas in immediate action

archetypes.label: Grounded Operator
archetypes.description: Strong execution logic, lower meta-awareness. Great at implementation and operational clarity.

archetypes.label: Dreaming Idealist
archetypes.description: High emotional and novelty scores, lower practical logic. Rich imaginative output needing structural scaffolding.

archetypes.label: Balanced Strategist
archetypes.description: Evenly-distributed metrics indicating a balanced cognitive profile.

validationRules.description: There must be exactly six phases.
Each phase must have at least one primary metric.
Each prompt referenced in a phase must exist in prompts array.

devNotes: This file is the authoritative MCIF schema. For maintainability, keep prompts in /prompts/ files and reference them here.
Large prompt banks and language variants should be split into /prompts/phase_x_prompts.json

coherenceHeuristicDetail.goal: Provide a simple deterministic coherence heuristic for front-end scoring.
algorithm: Compute connectiveRatio = (#connectiveTokens / sentenceCount) where connectiveTokens are 'therefore, because, thus, however'.
Compute averageSentenceLength = tokens / sentenceCount; penalize extremely short fragments.
Compute metaphorPenalty if metaphor detected and unrelated to prompt; low penalty if metaphor enhances insight.
coherenceHeuristicDetail.notes: This is deterministic and transparent; replace with semantic similarity later if adapter present.

bayesianTemplateDetail.goal: Explain how the bayesian_engine adapter should compute posteriors.
pseudocode: For each latent trait T (metric), set prior P(T) from calibration fixtures.
Given response R, compute likelihood L(R|T) via scoring engine heuristics (normalize).
Combine multiple prompts by multiplying likelihoods (or using log-sum) and renormalizing.
bayesianTemplateDetail.notes: When enabling Bayesian adapter, ensure prior calibration is robust using fixtures.
